wikipedia_page.main: Donovan Winter (1933 – 6 February 2015) was a British film director, actor and writer. He was born to Irish parents in London in 1933 and died on 6 February 2015 in the UK aged 82.

response: * Donovan Winter (?–2015), British film director, actor, and writer
|Give Us Tomorrow||Donovan Winter||Sylvia Syms, Derren Nesbitt||Crime||
Give Us Tomorrow is a 1978 British crime film directed by Donovan Winter and starring Sylvia Syms, Derren Nesbitt and James Kerry.BFI.org
The Trunk is a low budget, black and white 1961 British mystery film directed by Donovan Winter and starring Phil Carey, Julia Arnall and  Dermot Walsh.

World Without Shame is a 1962 British naturist film directed by Donovan Winter and starring Yvonne Martell.Simon Sheridan, Keeping the British End Up: Four Decades of Saucy Cinema, Titan Books 2011 p 44-45

Come Back Peter is a 1969 British sex comedy film written, produced, edited and directed by Donovan Winter. It was released in the UK under the title Some Like It Sexy.Simon Sheridan, Keeping the British End Up: Four Decades of Saucy Cinema, Titan Books, 2011, p. 63-64.

Escort Girls is a 1974 sexploitation film written, produced and directed by Donovan Winter and starring Helen Christie, Brian Jackson, David Dixon, Veronica Doran and David Brierly. Its working title was All Lovers Are Strangers.
Actors who appeared in individual episodes of the series included Michael Caine, Wilfrid Brambell, Ralph Nossek, Erik Chitty, Frank Middlemass, Cyril Shaps and Donovan Winter.
